page.title: 07Local History - Maylands
page.content: Dengie Hundred Witbrictesherna - Wihtbeorht's Corner - Domesday Book lO86-now Dengie Peninsula. Home of the Daenningas folk - marshland people or a woodland pasture for swine. Mundon- Munduna Domesday Book - possibly Anglo Saxon - a sheltering hill.Lawling - Laellinge 896 Kembe Codex Diplomaticus ' in quadam vocata Lallynge'. Graeco- Phoenician vase found on site of Marsh Farm. Latchingdon - Laecedune 1O42-66 Westminster Domesday Book. Laecen-full of watercourses so 'well-watered hill' Mayland - la Mailanda 1182-92 Pipe Rolls. Old English 'mayweed' and land. Nipsells Farm Gynpesho 123O Old English - derivative ' spur of land' To be known officially as 'The Maylands'.
